page.title: 18Gipsy Encampment
page.content: Gipsies are people who have abandoned an orthodox life-style to roam around the countryside in caravans which are their homes.There are two main types of gipsy:Romany who are continually on the move and diddie-coys who spend long periods of time in one place.The Romany have horses which are used to pull the brightly-coloured carts from fair to fair.In this area they always use{Boldron Lane}and{Thornberry Lane} as encampments during their unhurried journey to Appleby Fair.They graze the horses by the roadside and visit the nearby homesteads to sell their wares. The diddie-coys have vehicles which pull aluminium caravans with ornately decorated interiors.They treat Appleby Fair as a holiday,spending the rest of their time in fixed locations.They are not true gipsy.Some tend to be untidy, thus upsetting the local residents.
